# About Me 
 
## About Me

I was born in Dénia (Spain) in 1972 and graduated in Statistics (2000). I got my PhD in Statistics in 2009 The thesis title was “Geostastistical models for bioclimatic indices” and my advisor were Javier MOrales and Antonio López-Quílez.

I have been teaching and doing research in the Miguel Hernández University  since 2005 I became Associate Professor of Statistics and Operations Research in 2018.

## Research groups to which I belong

-  **Valencia Bayesian Research Group (VABAR)**. Based at the University of Valencia and heir of prominent Bayesians like Susie Bayarri and Juan Ferrándiz.

 - **Statistical Modeling Ecology Group (SMEG)**. An inter-disciplinary research group, linking researchers from the Schools of Mathematics and Statistics, Biology and Ecology.
